tqi.name: Security
tqi.description: A representation of the static vulnerabilies and weaknesses of a CSharp project or solution.

characteristics.name: Confidentiality
characteristics.description: Degree to which a product or system ensures that data are accessible only to those authorized to have access.

characteristics.name: Integrity
characteristics.description: Degree to which a system, product or component prevents unauthorized access to, or modification of, computer programs or data.

characteristics.name: Non-repudiation
characteristics.description: Degree to which actions or events can be proven to have taken place, so that the events or actions cannot be repudiated later.

characteristics.name: Accountability
characteristics.description: Degree to which the actions of an entity can be traced uniquely to the entity.

characteristics.name: Authenticity
characteristics.description: Degree to which the identity of a subject or resource can be proved to be the one claimed.

properties.name: Injection
properties.description: Injection flaws occur when an attacker can send hostile data to an interpreter.

properties.name: Cryptography
properties.description: Cryptography flaws involve vulnerabilities to decrpting content through flaws such as invalidated certificates, weak hashing functions, and weak cipher algorithms.
